alert.note: Alert for Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 9:43PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Fremont County through 1015 PM MDT... At 940 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicates a cluster of thunderstorms that have merged together over central Fremont County. Storms are producing small hail and locally heavy rainfall, which could lead to rock slides along Highway 50 in Fremont County, especially from Texas Creek to Canon City. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rainfall could lead to localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Royal Gorge and Canon City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
